definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
Fenchihu, town in Chiayi County, Taiwan

sentences.english: There must be a specialty of large peas Fencihu.
sentences.chinese: 其中一定會有奮起湖的特產大碗豆。

sentences.english: Passengers had rebelled against the hijackers, who had turned the plane toward Washington.
sentences.chinese: 劫機者將飛機掉頭飛往華盛頓，乘客們奮起反抗。

sentences.english: The entire nation raised up and drove the enemy soldiers out from their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 整個民族奮起反抗，把敵兵從國土上趕了出去。

sentences.english: Mum suggests that I should cheer up when meeting with setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽建議我在遇到挫折時應振奮起來。

sentences.english: At the critical moment, he plunged himself into the anti-Japanese war.
sentences.chinese: 在民族危機時刻他奮起投入了抗日救亡運動。

sentences.english: His friends' words inspired him to try again.
sentences.chinese: 他朋友的話使他振奮起來再試一次。

sentences.english: A catch-up is imminent, say the bulls.
sentences.chinese: 看漲者認爲，股市不久將奮起直追。

sentences.english: May the road rise up to greet you, and the wind always be at your back.
sentences.chinese: 願道路奮起歡迎你，願風浪常在你身後。

sentences.english: The entire universe need not arm itself to crush him.
sentences.chinese: 整個天地不必奮起全力來將他剿殺。

sentences.english: Procrastination at the top during a crisis antagonized the board of directors.
sentences.chinese: 公司高管在危機中的延宕促使董事會奮起行動。

sentences.english: The entire country rose up and drove the Austrian soldiers from their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 全國人民奮起反抗，把奧軍從他們的國土上驅逐出去。

sentences.english: Gather yourself together and begin to work.
sentences.chinese: 振奮起精神開始工作吧。

sentences.english: We shouldn't cower when confronted by evil forces, we should rise and fight them.
sentences.chinese: 對於邪惡勢力我們不應重足而立，而是要奮起抗爭。

sentences.english: Her friend's words inspired him to try again.
sentences.chinese: 她朋友的話使她振奮起來再試一次。

sentences.english: Do not sink, in any environment you can choose to rise.
sentences.chinese: 不要沉淪，在任何環境中你都可以選擇奮起。

definition: dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to wail/to cry out in distress
